title: Fatigue and Fracture: Understanding the Basics c2012 Campbell
description:
Fatigue and Fracture: Understanding the Basics (c2012), edited by Flake C. Campbell (ASM International).

TEXTBOOK INFO: <a href=" http://www.asminternational.org/technical-books/-/journal_content/56/10192/05361G/PUBLICATION" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.asminternational.org/technical-books/-/journal_content/56/10192/05361G/PUBLICATION</a>
(ISBN-13: 9781615039760 print)

BRIEF CONTENTS:
--------------
1. Introduction to Fatigue and Fracture
2. Mechanical Behavior
3. Ductile and Brittle Fracture
4. Fracture Mechanics
5. Fatigue of Metals
6. Fatigue and Fracture of Engineering Alloys
7. Metallic Joints- Mechanically Fastened and Welded
8. Fracture Control and Damage Tolerance Analysis
9. Fatigue and Fracture of Ceramics and Polymers
10. Fatigue and Fracture of Continuous Fiber Polymer Matrix Composites
11. High Temperature Failures
12. Wear Failures
13. Environmentally-Induced Failures
14. The Failure Analysis Process
APPENDIX: Defects Leading to Failure
(detailed contents at website above)

FILE INFO: paginated, bookmarked, true PDF. The poor downsampling job with
           numerous raster objects in this book is not mine but that of ASM
           International (Download the sample chapter offered at their website
           above or preview their Google Book from their website to check).
           The digital copy is OK for evaluating the book however
